channel.title: Jeff Blog
channel.description: A blog about career change and trials of a non-trad CS grad.
channel.author: Jeff Patterson

item.title: My, What a Busy Week!
item.description: Top Pick of the Week: Women Who Code: DevOps Study Night: Scripting & Automation What: Getting hands-on with DevOps in a group that empowers…
item.dc:creator: Jeff Patterson
item.content:encoded:
Top Pick of the Week:

Women Who Code: DevOps Study Night: Scripting & Automation

What: Getting hands-on with DevOps in a group that empowers women in tech and provides the ultimate atmosphere of inclusion —who could ask for more!? WWC should be winning awards, not only for its success in fulfilling its mission, but for the quality of its workshops. I can't wait for Wednesday!

When: Wednesday, 6/6/2018.

RSVP: DevOps Study Night: Scripting & Automation

Other Events

Out in Tech Monthly Social

What: Out in Tech's monthly social at Crush.

When: Tuesday, 6/5/2018

RSVP: Out in Tech on Eventbright

A great place to meet and support LGBTQ people in tech. OiT is a very active community with great talks and fun socials. They also support LGBTQ communities all over the world by providing web services in areas of the world that aren't particularly safe for LGBT people. OiT has groups in most major cities in the US, and others across the globe.

The Portland group has lots of attendees from some very big names in tech who seem to have a lot of involvement in organizing events and being very active in the OiT leadership community.

The Tea

The Portland social group is made up of mostly young gay men, but I believe OiT is actively working to be more welcoming and actively inclusive of the more diverse range of Portland's LGBT tech community by hosting panels with Lesbian, Trans, Non-binary, and Women leaders from diverse cultural backgrounds.

At OiT socials, I've observed that circles seem to form (quite early in the night) based on status, age, gender, and looks. Could there be a conscious, fun way for us to resist the urge to self-organize into circles this way? Until this breaking of circles becomes the OiT social culture, the unintended impact may be that many people (women, older people, trans people, people of varying weights and looks) with valuable ideas might feel excluded and go elsewhere.

OiT PDX is off to a good start though. The "From URL to IRL" panel talk was one of the highlights of the season for me, and the socials are definitely worth attending in spite of my criticism above. If you're LGBTQ and in tech, you should RSVP right now! See you Tuesday!

item.title: Workspace Mirrors Hobby Space
item.description: Adding a hobby space is the best thing I did for myself and my productivity. While I was in college, I had a professor who kept several…
item.dc:creator: Jeff Patterson
item.content:encoded:
Adding a hobby space is the best thing I did for myself and my productivity.

While I was in college, I had a professor who kept several musical instruments lying around his workspace. I always thought this was super cool, and it made his space feel very friendly.

I asked him about it. He said, "Every once-in-a-while I just play some music to clear my mind, then go back to work."

I decided to double my desk back-to-back and place an electronic keyboard across from my workspace. Now if my wheels start spinning, or if I start feeling the need for a break, I can just walk around to the other side of my desk and play for a while.

Since I've had the music space, I've noticed that my stress and fatigue has decreased significantly and my mind seems more ready to think when I need to.

I'm also becoming a better keyboard player!

item.title: Welcome
item.description: Hello to You! Join me in my adventures breaking into the software industry as a non-trad recent CS grad. I've been actively looking for a…
item.dc:creator: Jeff Patterson
item.content:encoded:
Hello to You!

Join me in my adventures breaking into the software industry as a non-trad recent CS grad.

I've been actively looking for a great team to bring my skills and experience to since February. While looking, I'm using my free time to explore tech that I didn't have the opportunity to explore in school. I'm excited about all the possibilities, and I'm really enjoying meeting people in the Portland software community at various meetups.

Blog Goals

I'll try to approach my observations with honesty, humility, curiosity, and inclusiveness, but I'll also be opinionated and loud about experiences that conflict with, reinforce, or otherwise bring attention to my values and assumptions.
